definitions.definition: To get into one's hands, possession or control, with or without force.
definitions.example: I'll take that plate off the table.

definitions.definition: To receive or accept (something) (especially something given or bestowed, awarded, etc).
definitions.example: The camera takes 35mm film.

definitions.definition: To remove.
definitions.example: take two eggs from the carton

definitions.definition: To have sex with.
To defeat (someone or something) in a fight.
definitions.example: Don't try to take that guy. He's bigger than you.

definitions.definition: To grasp or grip.
definitions.example: He took her hand in his.

definitions.definition: To select or choose; to pick.
definitions.example: I'll take the blue plates.

definitions.definition: To adopt (select) as one's own.
definitions.example: She took his side in every argument.

definitions.definition: To carry or lead (something or someone).
definitions.example: I'll take the plate with me.

definitions.definition: To use as a means of transportation.
definitions.example: He took the bus to London, and then took a train to Manchester.

definitions.definition: To visit; to include in a course of travel.
To obtain for use by payment or lease.
definitions.example: He took a full-page ad in the Times.

definitions.definition: To consume.
To experience, undergo, or endure.
To cause to change to a specified state or condition.
definitions.example: He had to take it apart to fix it.

definitions.definition: To regard in a specified way.
definitions.example: He took the news badly.

definitions.definition: To conclude or form (a decision or an opinion) in the mind.
definitions.example: took a dim view of city officials

definitions.definition: To understand (especially in a specified way).
definitions.example: Don't take my comments as an insult.

definitions.definition: To accept or be given (rightly or wrongly); assume (especially as if by right).
definitions.example: He took all the credit for the project, although he had done almost none of the work.

definitions.definition: To believe, to accept the statements of.
definitions.example: take her word for it

definitions.definition: To assume or suppose; to reckon; to regard or consider.
definitions.example: Do you take me for a fool?

definitions.definition: To draw, derive, or deduce (a meaning from something).
definitions.example: I'm not sure what moral to take from that story.

definitions.definition: To derive (as a title); to obtain from a source.
definitions.example: "As I Lay Dying" takes its title from Book XI of Homer's "Odyssey"

definitions.definition: To catch or contract (an illness, etc).
definitions.example: took a chill

definitions.definition: To come upon or catch (in a particular state or situation).
To captivate or charm; to gain or secure the interest or affection of.
definitions.example: took her attention

definitions.definition: (of a material) To absorb or be impregnated by (dye, ink, etc); to be susceptible to being treated by (polish, etc).
definitions.example: cloth that takes dye well

definitions.definition: (of a ship) To let in (water).
To require.
definitions.example: Finishing this on schedule will take a lot of overtime.

definitions.definition: To proceed to fill.
definitions.example: He took a seat in the front row.

definitions.definition: To fill, to use up (time or space).
definitions.example: His collection takes a lot of space.

definitions.definition: To avail oneself of.
definitions.example: He took that opportunity to leave France.

definitions.definition: To practice; perform; execute; carry out; do.
definitions.example: Pirès ran in to take the kick.

definitions.definition: To assume or perform (a form or role).
To bind oneself by.
definitions.example: he took the oath of office last night

definitions.definition: To move into.
definitions.example: the next team took the field

definitions.definition: To go into, through, or along.
definitions.example: go down two blocks and take the next left

definitions.definition: To have and use one's recourse to.
definitions.example: take cover/shelter/refuge

definitions.definition: To ascertain or determine by measurement, examination or inquiry.
definitions.example: take a census

definitions.definition: To write down; to get in, or as if in, writing.
definitions.example: He took a mental inventory of his supplies.

definitions.definition: To make (a photograph, film, or other reproduction of something).
definitions.example: Could you take a picture of us?

definitions.definition: To take a picture, photograph, etc of (a person, scene, etc).
definitions.example: The photographer will take you sitting down.

definitions.definition: To obtain money from, especially by swindling.
definitions.example: took me for ten grand

definitions.definition: (now chiefly by enrolling in a class or course) To apply oneself to the study of.
definitions.example: As a child, she took ballet.

definitions.definition: To deal with.
definitions.example: take matters as they arise

definitions.definition: To consider in a particular way, or to consider as an example.
definitions.example: I've had a lot of problems recently: take last Monday, for example. My car broke down on the way to work. Then ... etc.

definitions.definition: To decline to swing at (a pitched ball); to refrain from hitting at, and allow to pass.
definitions.example: He'll probably take this one.

definitions.definition: To accept as an input to a relation.
To get or accept (something) into one's possession.
definitions.example: My husband and I have a dysfunctional marriage. He just takes and takes; he never gives.

definitions.definition: To engage, take hold or have effect.
To become; to be affected in a specified way.
definitions.example: She took sick with the flu.

definitions.definition: (possibly obsolete) To be able to be accurately or beautifully photographed.
An intensifier.
To deliver, bring, give (something) to (someone).
(obsolete outside dialectal and slang) To give or deliver (a blow, to someone); to strike or hit.
definitions.example: He took me a blow on the head.

definitions.definition: Infatuated; fond of or attracted to.
definitions.example: He was very taken with the girl, I hear.

definitions.definition: In a serious romantic relationship.
definitions.example: I can't ask her out, she's taken.
